title: Adjuct Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Saint Xavier University
Interview Descriptions: It was easy interview, interview was kinda long but applied a long time ago before they reached out. The person on the phone was friendly. I got another offer thats why I declined the offer.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your education experience.

title: Student Orientation Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Saint Xavier University (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: I enjoyed the interview process. First there was the application, then a day where all the student leaders that gathered and leadership could see each person's personality, then the interview, then orientation.
Interview Questions: What would you do to help make a student feel more comfortable as a student leader?

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Saint Xavier University
Interview Descriptions: The interview was easy. We talked for a long time about what the job would entail and compared that to my qualifications. It was an overall friendly interview process to go through.
Interview Questions: Past experience working on marketing campaigns

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Saint Xavier University (Chicago, IL) in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was straight forward comprised of two group interviews. One with the staff I would be working with and the other with upper management.  The process was quick: from start to finish, it was just a few days.
Interview Questions: The interview included behavioral questions.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Saint Xavier University
Interview Descriptions: Simple interview, basic questions were asked and answered on both sides of the table. The job was offered and accepted. Worked there for a year and then the internship ended.
Interview Questions: Are you comfortable with writing

title: Director of Student Services Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Saint Xavier University
Interview Descriptions: It was very quick, seemed unorganized a little because I was told one day then got pushed up to a new date which caused me to not be as prepared as I would have liked to be
Interview Questions: How I work to help student students

title: Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Saint Xavier University (Chicago, IL) in Dec 2019
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with basic questions, why was I interested in this position at this location.  They asked about my background and previous positions in advising.  We discussed my other previous positions, too.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Writing Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Saint Xavier University (Chicago, IL) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: I sat in the director of the learning center's office in which we had a 1:1 in-person interview. The interview was somewhat like a conversation. They want to know if you have the interpersonal/professional skills and passion necessary to teach/educate.
Interview Questions:
Why do you want to be a writing consultant. 
How would you handle a nervous/timid student that wants a tutoring session?
How would you handle a difficult/rebellious student that is required by their professor to have this session.

title: Student Affairs Clerical Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Saint Xavier University in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: I walked into the office and asked if they were hiring. They told me to fill out an application online. Then they called me and told me to come into the office for an interview, It was very short. It was a very easy interview. They did more of the talking than I did. They basically told me what I would expect and asked a couple questions. They hired me on the spot. But, I had a connection with the boss through a friend. That might have something to do with how easy it was.
Interview Questions: What do you know about student affairs?

title: Saint Xavier University Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Saint Xavier University (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: I was hired on the spot pretty much, because I fulfilled all the qualifications and knew the supervisor previously from her being a tutor for my Calculus class.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: IT Helpdesk Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Saint Xavier University (Chicago, IL) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was randomly pulled into the director's office and asked to talk about myself. The only reason the process took so long was because the director was never available to meet.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself? Why do you want to work here?

title: Digital Media Specialist Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Saint Xavier University (Chicago, IL) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions:
The interview panel consisted of two individuals. 

This was the most unprofessional interview I have ever attended. 

When I arrived, one of the interviewers shook my hand but she did not proceed to tell me her name. The interview lasted about 20 minutes, I was only asked about my background, I was given no time to ask questions about the position, and the interviewers kept mentioning to each other about a photo shoot they had to attend following the interview. To top it off, as I was preparing to show them a new project from my portfolio, one of the interviewers proceeded to let me know that she was going to check her voicemail as I was getting it ready.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your background.

title: Director, Instructional Design & Academic Technology Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Saint Xavier University (Chicago, IL) in Oct 2010
Interview Descriptions:
Standard one-hour phone interview.  A series of questions about my experience and qualifications. Limited time for follow-up.  Conciseness is at a premium: you must be able to translate your experience to the requirements of the position.

Only three or four members of the search committee were present.
Interview Questions: N/A
